intro: Psychanthus roemeri, commonly known as the Roemeri's psychanthus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
